text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to identify, per German Civ. Pro. Code (ZPO) 1032(1), that German courts must decline jurisdiction when arbitration agreements exist. The candidate answer explicitly addresses this under Section I.B, Third: 'Even if you don't get an anti-suit injunction (or as a parallel strategy), the German court itself may decline jurisdiction. Under \u00a7 1032 ZPO (German Code of Civil Procedure), a German court must refer parties to arbitration if a valid arbitration agreement covers the dispute...'. This directly satisfies the requirement.", "criterion_id": "1e1996f6-c1bd-451d-a75c-92f3f6fa6094"}
